content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"How should the Quality Management System be implemented?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"According to what rules and principles should this system work?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Of course, everything can be created from scratch, but that would be like reinventing the wheel. In order to save additional efforts while developing this system, various international standards of the industry can (and should) be used.These standards reflect the best practices of large, successful enterprises. Of course, the number of existing standards is very large, but it is not necessary to employ all of them. As for EPAM, our Company incorporates four world standards: ISO 9001, CMMI, ISO 27001 and COBIT. Let's have a quick look at each of them.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"ISO 9001\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/4bd080ec-04d3-4e07-97c4-b30c004aaf77/img9.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":173,\"height\":69}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"ISO\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" – International Standardization Organization– works on developing standards for many industries. This organization has developed the 9000 standard series, which are considered the most universal and widely-used. Nowadays it is very hard to find a company that would not be using these standards.The ISO 9000 standards are applicable for all enterprises, regardless of the number of employees, production capacity and field of business. They define the basic principles upon which QMS must be founded.The main standard is ISO 9001 (Quality management systems — Requirements).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"What does ISO have to offer?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The main idea is a process approach to company management. A process approach infers that all Company activities are perceived as separate processes. Essentially, any type of activity can be observed as a process, be it software development, delivery of tea/coffee to the offices, purchase of required equipment, or technical support. The result of each process directly or indirectly affects the quality of the end product. This means that, the better a process is set up – the higher the chance to create a top-quality product.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"So what is a process? And how is it managed?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/34a6c1a6-e8d4-428c-a3d8-07850a42cc77/img10.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":423,\"height\":235}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A process is a set of interrelated or interacting activities, which use the resources and technology to transform inputs into outputs and bring the result.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/d57c9da2-647e-4166-a428-bbae31603c3c/img11.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":445,\"height\":194}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"For example, product development: requirements are the input, the build is the output; requirements development: the customer's needs are the input, complete requirement specifications are the output. All processes are interconnected, they cooperate with one another, i.e. the result (output) of one process is another one's input.A successful process requires resources (people, tools, an environment, methodical materials, etc.), clearly defined roles and responsibilities within the process, evaluation of the efficiency of the process (for more details see a project or purchasing a new system is always determined by the goals of the Company. Organizational development strategy and planning lie within the responsibilities of the top management (see Management Responsibility).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Resources are required for the realisation of corporate goals, be it product development for external customers or service provision for internal user decisions about resource allocation are also made by the top management (see Resource Management). As soon as the resources are allocated – the activity itself is launched, product development/service provision (see Product Realization).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The result of this activity is the product delivered or service provided to the Customer. Every such Company activity is analyzed in order to evaluate its efficiency or the options for improvement (see Measurement and analysis).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A very important thing for this analysis is Customer feedback (both internal and external) about the product/service quality. Based on the results, the top management makes decisions about improvements and changes in corporate processes (see Management Responsibility), for which, again, resources are planned and allocated (see Resource Management). This works not only at the organizational level, but also at the level of each individual project.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In EPAM, \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"product realization processes\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" are such as Software Development, Quality Control (Testing), Requirement Development, etc.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Providing\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" processes are: Human Resource Management, Org Training, Org Process Management, Measurement and Analysis.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"ISO 9000 does not dictate which exact processes a company must employ and how they must interact, it simply defines the general principles of how these processes must be developed and monitored. This is the standard's strongest and weakest point at the same time.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Of course, flexibility is great, but what's next? While defining which processes our company needs and how they are going to work, we can make the mistake of reducing the effort to nothing which would result in an inefficient system.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"CMMI\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/f7a34be2-d4cd-49d6-b65a-956a60ca0b67/img14.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":175,\"height\":82}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"That is where the CMMI model steps in. This model is \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Capability Maturity Model\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" Integration specifically for software development companies. At the very beginning, CMMI was developed as a methodology to help large governmental organizations of the USA choose the best software vendors.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The Pentagon needed to develop and implement a big and serious system, and they sent a request to a software development outsourcing company. Huge amounts of time and money were spent, but eventually the project was not realized. Another company was hired – the result was the same. In the end, the Pentagon inquired at the Software Engineering Institute (SEI) of Carnegie Mellon University to help them choose a trustworthy vendor.The solution that was supposed to help choose a company was based NOT on the analysis of already released products (something like “Oh look, they made a super-cool system for someone, it is possible that they will be able to meet our requirements”), but on the evaluation of the development process setup within the company. If adequate processes are used for managing projects, requirements, development and testing, then there is a good chance that the project will be completed on time. As a result, clear and detailed requirements for processes were developed, and this methodology was adopted by manufacturers to develop and improve internal processes.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-italic\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"CMMI defines\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"five levels\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" of a company's maturity:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/9e5e07d2-241c-4728-ae00-aa2abf2f7a82/pict4_04.jpg\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":535,\"height\":336}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"1 – Initial\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Processes are not defined, development is chaotic and ad-hoc. i.e. any company has the 1st CMMI level by default.\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"2 – Managed\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Processes are defined and documented, but they are focused on a particular project, i.e. they differ significantly on different projects (up to a point that the process of each project is unique). There are processes for each type of project.\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"3 – Defined\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". All processes on all projects follow a defined corporate standard, the so-called standard organizational process. Processes are defined at company level. All documents are unified to the maximum extent, a Project Manager only makes a tailoring of standard processes to the project needs.\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"4 – Quantitatively Managed\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". On this maturity level measurements and metrics are gathered from projects, accumulated at the organizational level and analyzed. Based on the analysis results Project Managers can make forecasts for their projects (e.g. how long requirement implementation will take, how many bugs will appear, what are the chances of meeting the deadlines according to the specific project conditions, and more). At the company-wide level a top-manager has the possibility to analyze processes concerning their stability and predictability.\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"5 – Optimizing\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\". Processes are being constantly improved and the company is able to implement significant innovations into processes based on the analysis of quantitative indicators; to identify root causes of problems on projects and to prevent their occurrence.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"COBIT/ISAE3402, ISO 27001\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Two other standards that need to be mentioned are ISO 27001 and COBIT. They define the requirements in the fields of information security and IT-infrastructure.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you have questions regarding this section, please seek assistance from your Manager or your HR Business Partner or send them to:\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"mailto:WFTPAL@epam.com\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"WFTPAL@epam.com\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\".\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
